Remembering how she didn’t believe you when you told the truth earlier, you tell her a partial truth. "I liked it," you say simply. You force yourself to smile and thank her for accepting your decision (something young children don't normally get). After dinner, your mother helps you pack away the feminine parts of your room: exchanging the pink bedclothes and bedspread for a white and gray set, exchanging the carpet for a dull blue one, packing away the costumes, skirts, and dresses, etc. Although you'd prefer to throw that stuff away, your mother insists on putting it in storage (it's the only way she'll agree to help). 15112112121222212.content:
Time passes with no hint of any way to change back. Many years pass, and you remain Chloe. You soon begin school and due to your teenage knowledge are declared a genius. You remain friends with Rick, and no matter what, you remain a steadfast tomboy.

It is now ten years after you became Chloe, and you are now 15. But there is little resemblance to the 15-year-old Chloe you had briefly turned into before becoming 5-year-old Chloe. Whereas that Chloe was quite girly (even being her briefly, that was obvious), you are a fierce and steadfast tomboy. Your room is colored in whites, grays, and dull blue instead of pink. You haven't touched dolls since destroying them with Rick that first day, and you never touched (or even considered) cosmetics, makeup, or jewelry. Your clothes are modest and as tomboyish and gender-neutral as possible, and your hair is kept shoulder-length and unkempt. After failing for years to find a way to change back, you've resigned to having no choice but to live as Chloe, but remaining a tomboy has made it much less painful than you initially thought.

All these thoughts go through your head as you get up.

info.brief_description: A teenage boy wakes up as a teenage girl
info.description:
You are Jake, a 16 year old boy. After an idle thought admiring the school hottie at the mall, you wake up the next morning as a 15 year old girl called Chloe

You soon find that Jake still is Jake (at least in mind), yet you're stuck as a girl. Do you succeed finding a way back or do you slowly become the new school hottie?



Rules
